message.content:
cs.DB, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.DC 

This paper deals with probabilistic databases and their efficient querying, which is a topic that falls under the database (cs.DB) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The use of Probability Generating Functions (PGF) and polynomials to answer queries also involves concepts from discrete mathematics and algorithms, making the data structures (cs.DS) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories relevant. Finally, the scalability of the proposed method and its ability to handle massive amounts of data make the distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC) sub-category a possible fit as well.
